item.title: Amelia add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "You can't plow a field simply by turning it over in your mind." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Amelia add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Good books are as friends, willing to give to us if we are willing to make a little effort." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Amelia add a quote by Emily Dickenson
item.description: "They might not need me; but they might. I'll let my head be just in sight; A smile as small as mine might be Precisely their necessity." -- Emily Dickenson

item.title: Amelia add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "The homemaker has the ultimate career. All other careers exist for one purpose only - and that is to support the ultimate career. " -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Amelia add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Amelia add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Amelia add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Amelia add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Amelia add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Amelia add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Amelia add a quote by A.A. Milne
Amelia add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Be careful about reading health books. You may die of a misprint." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Amelia add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Life seems but a quick succession of busy nothings." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Amelia add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Women are meant to be loved, not to be understood." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Amelia add a quote by Robin McKinley
item.description: "The story is always better than your ability to write it." -- Robin McKinley

item.title: Amelia add a quote by Robin McKinley
item.description: "My books happen. They tend to blast in from nowhere, seize me by the throat, and howl 'Write me! Write me now!' But they rarely stand still long enough for me to see what and who they are, before they hurtle away again. And so I spend a lot of time running after them, like a thrown rider after an escaped horse, saying 'Wait for me! Wait for me!' and waving my notebook in the air." -- Robin McKinley

item.title: Amelia add a quote by Robin McKinley
item.description: "I found that the only way I could control this sorrow was not to think of [it] at all, which was almost as painful as the loss itself." -- Robin McKinley

item.title: Amelia add a quote by Robin McKinley
item.description: "When you write your first novel you don't really know what you're doing. There may be writers out there who are brilliant, incisive and in control from their first 'Once upon a time'. I'm not one of them. Every once upon a time for me is another experience of white-water rafting in a leaky inner tube. And I have this theory that while the Story Council has its faults, it does have some idea that if books are going to get written, authors have to be able to write them." -- Robin McKinley

item.title: Amelia add a quote by Robin McKinley
item.description: "I advise those who want to become writers to study veterinary medicine, which is easier. You don't want to be a writer unless you have no choice - and if you have no choice, good luck to you." -- Robin McKinley
